person.persName: John H. Frost (Hopkins County farmer and member of 25th and 17th Kentucky Infantry)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John B. Frost and Mary Frost. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860.Household owned thirteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860. Private in the 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 1861 to December 1861. The 25th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) consolidated into the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.). Promoted to corporeal of the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) and served from December 1861 to April 1862. Promoted to sergeant and served from April 1862 to November 1862. Promoted to sergeant major and served from November 1862 to December 1862. Promoted to second lieutenant and served from December 1862 to August 1863. Promoted to first lieutenant and served from August 1863 to September 1864. Promoted to captain and served from September 1864 to January 1865.
